text:
If you like salt, you'll love this recipe.  It had a lot of flavor, but was way to salty for us.  My son who is addicted to salt and vinegar potato chips, couldn't even eat this. I did double the sauce and only added one packet of the salad dressing mix and it was still too salty. I almost made it for company but decided to try it first, glad I did. I must say the chicken was very tender and moist and the basic recipe has potential. I may try again with 1/2 dressing packet, plain cream cheese, unsalted butter and fresh chives.

userID:
1200195
Display Name:
paynes
isPro:

1

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/101158.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
OK.  I really hate giving this recipe only 4 stars, but I was a little disappointed.  I've had this in my recipe box for weeks and have been so excited to try it.  I followed the recipe exactly.  The only difference was that I used light cream cheese w/chives.  I tasted the sauce before I put it in the oven and was really nervous because the flavor was very strong.  The flavor lighted up after cooking along with the sauce thinning, but it was still very salty.  I only cooked for 40 min and the butter was beginning to separate.  Next time I won't use all of the Italian packet.  I think that's what made it so salty.  I may also try chicken broth instead of wine as others suggested and less butter.  I also think fettucini noodles would work well with such a thick sauce.  The flavor was great, just too salty for me.  Too many changes to make to give 5 stars.

Update:  I changed this to 5 stars, after using chicken broth instead of wine and store brand Italian dressing, this is perfect.  I think my previous combination of wine and name brand seasoning were just too salty.  I love this dish!  If you don't like it the first time, you made need to try a different seasoning packet.
Review:
Rating:
5

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I modified this recipe by first seasoning 4 chicken breasts, cutting them into chunks and then browning them.  I also sauteed some chopped red onions and sliced muchrooms.  I put the chicken and veggies into the crockpot and added all the sauce ingredients plus a can of chicken broth.  I cooked it on low for about 6 hours and then served it over pasta.  I must not have mixed the sauce ingredients well because it was very clumpy looking and unappetizing.  It improved once I whisked it for awhile before I served it.  I thought it was just okay, nothing special.  It tasted processed to me.  My husband, four year old and two year old all thought it was fabulous.  They practically licked their plates. I just couldn't bring myself to give it 5 stars, although they certainly would have.

Display Name:
JENTEGGE

photo:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My husband loved this sauce.  I am going to try it with shrimp next time.  I sauted the chicken, like someone suggested but will not next time.  The popping grease made a huge mess and the lovely brown color dissappeared after baking anyway.  I strongly recommend doubling the sauce.  I doubled everything but the butter and the salad dressing mix. I believe you must use the golden mushroom soup mix and season your chicken.  The sauce was delicious.  Even better the second day.  I also added heavy cream to mellow wine flavor.  My father in law does not drink wine but next time I will leave it alone.

text:
We just enjoyed this delicious dish for Sunday dinner.  It was wonderful!  Took the advice of a previous poster and made it in the crockpot (4-5 hours on low).  First, I sauteed the chicken in half the butter, then added with all the remaining ingredients to the crockpot.  Also added a can of chicken broth (we like lots of sauce) and a packet of chicken gravy mix (the broth made it too watery... the gravy mix addition resulted in the perfect consistency).  My husband of 11 years said this was his new favorite meal!  Served with Roquefort Pear Salad (from this website) and it was the perfect meal.  Thanks, Marian, for this great recipe!  Will make again and again!

text:
Definately would make it again. My kids and husband devoured it.  I used thin cut chicken breast.  Doing it this way, it served less people - about 3-4 servings, but gave us more sauce which came out perfect.  I prepped it the night before by doing everything up until putting the chicken dish in the oven.  I left it in the fridge and put it in the oven at 350 for 45 minutes (remember I used the thin cut) and cooked the pasta the next day.  Doing it this way, it was easy to throw together after I got home from work.

text:
OH MY!!! This was one of the best recipes I've tried. I usually don't like white pasta sauce but this one had just the right amount of flavor. To top that off my husband loved it and request that I make it again next week. I did make some modifications: I use cream of chicken mushroom soup and I doubled the recipe for additional sauce. I also added parmesan cheese to the baked sauce the last 20 minutes of baking. Also I seasoned my chicken and seared it in a little bit of olive oil on top of the stove. The sauce is sort of salty but I did not add any salt to my noodles as I boiled them. Next time I may add a little cream to cut the salt.  I also used linguine noodles instead of the noodles the recipe called for. Great!

This dish is very good. I rarely give 5 stars, so take no offense to that. This is a very good, easy to prepare meal. My husband & nephew both loved it. I will make it again. A lot.

text:
Very nice! I made this tonight for dinner and we both very much enjoyed it. This is what I did: I added the garlic while sauting the chicken and added a little salt and some seasoned pepper. (I wanted more flavor added to the chicken.) I also added red onion and asparagus to the veggies. (I would have LOVED to added some fresh mushrooms but didn't have any on hand.) I probably added a little more FRESHLY GRATED parmesan than the recipe called for... ~ 1/2 cup and garnished with some too. It was very flavorful. It does not make an alfredo sauce... it's a pasta prima vera! YUM! Thank you!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/23457.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Fantastic. I doubled the butter, wine, canned soup and cream cheese, added about a teaspoon of cayenne (or to your taste), and a can of sliced olives over the top before popping into the oven. Really amazing. DO make sure the cream cheese is softened, OR start the sauce with the cream cheese, melt it first over low heat, add the soup, then the rest of the ingredients (melt the butter in microwave before adding), and it comes out a lot smoother. Also, I have tried the chicken broth instead of white wine, and it came out distractingly salty. Definitely go low sodium with the broth if used.

This was awesome! So easy too! I did make a few adjustments though. I didn't have cream cheese and chives so i used regular. I used chicken tender strips and cut them into half and then half again.I used chicken broth as others stated, about 3/4 cup just to make it go a little further and to thin it out a bit without losing any flavor. I baked this for about a half hour maybe a little more. Everyone liked it even the kids!! I thought the strips made it easier for them to eat this. I also used penne instead of angel hair. I will definitley make a double batch next time. This was great!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made a few changes to this dish.  First, I used cream of chicken soup instead of the mushroom and low fat cream cheese instead of the full fat version.  I also skipped the wine and used water.  Second, I made the whole thing on the stovetop by cutting the chicken into bite sized pieces and cooking it in a saute pan, then I removed it and made the sauce.  After all of the sauce ingredients were combined, I added the chicken and cooked together while I boiled the water and cooked the pasta.

I thought this was very good.  My husband thought it was ok but he really does not care for creamy sauces.  There was plenty of sauce, but I only used two breasts since it was just my husband and I eating.  I think if I had used four breasts there still would have been enough sauce but using six would probably have needed more.  My husband also found the dish to be a bit salty, but I thought it was fine.  Overall, this is a good dish.  It was not resturant quality, but still very good.

I made the sauce the night before, and let the chicken defrost overnight. Then the next day all i had to do was spoon the sauce over the chicken and put it in the oven for an hour. That's it.  I used chicken broth instead of the white wine. One of the people at the dineer sounded like Bill Murray on the movie What About Bob? there were "mmm's" and "this is really good" all around the table. I have to admit, I didn't think it would be as good as it was. It was really good.  The smell is strong, but the taste is just right.  Super easy and delicious. Especially if you are coming home from work. Pop it in the oven while you are changing out of work clothes and relaxing, and then it'll be done.

I made this last night and everyone loved it. The sauce has a strogonoff-type flavor. With my modifications, the sauce was still a bit salty, but nothing over powering. Next time I'll try to add ingredients that are fat reduced, just to make it a little healthier. Overall a wonderful recipe.

text:
I was looking for a new chicken recipe and was happy to see this recipe.  It seemed easy enough, and from the ingredients it sounded real tasty.  I read through most of the reviews, and some people mentioned salty and winey, and doubling the sauce part.  I doubled the ingredients for the sauce part, but concerned about it being to salty or winey, I used the original amount of italian mix and wine. 2 out of 3 of my kids loved it,the other is just plain picky about food in general and my husband and I loved it.  My husband said "Put a star next to that recipe, that was delicious."  Even with altering the sauce ingredients, it still had great flavor, and I didn't feel that it was too salty.  I recommend it!  Oh and I used fettucine instead of angel hair, never had much luck with angel hair pasta.

text:
This dish is FOOLPROOF.  Great for a beginner.  I was concerned about the saltiness some reviewers commented on so I added about 1/4 to 1/2 cup of water and a little more wine.
 I think it needed an herb or spice though.  I cant figure out what..Maybe lemon juice or fresh chives on top.  I cooked it for a shorter time at a higher temp. and the chicken came out lovely and moist.  My family found it "cheesy" but ate it.  This is not gourmet fare but a perfectly fine easy dish.
